Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about "Lalka" by Bolesław Prus and its historical context:

## "Lalka" (The Doll) - Historical Context and Academic Information

"Lalka" (1890, "The Doll") is set in Warsaw under Russian rule in the late 1870s and gives a complex picture of Warsaw's social classes at the end of the century.(no content)The novel features embattled aristocrats, the new men of finance, Dickensian tradesmen, and the urban poor all brought vividly to life on a vast, superbly detailed canvas.

### Historical Setting and Partition Context

The historical backdrop is crucial: Prus was writing during a period when Poland had been partitioned out of political existence in the 18th century by Russia, Prussia, and Austria.(no content)Unlike his Western European counterparts, Prus had to work under official censorship, with most of the smaller cuts made by the Tsarist censor later restored in modern editions.

### Social History Depicted

This epic and detailed tale explores 19th century Warsaw, with Prus creating a vivid picture of the city and people against the background of economic, ideological and social transformations.(no content)The novel depicts a multicultural society including Poles, Jews, Russians, merchants and aristocracy.

### Author's Background and Historical Experience

Aleksander Głowacki (Prus's real name) joined the Polish 1863 Uprising against Imperial Russia at age 15, suffered severe battle injuries shortly after his 16th birthday, and was imprisoned five months later - experiences that may have shaped his opposition to seeking Poland's independence by force of arms.

### Literary and Academic Significance

Prus was one of the leading figures of the Positivist period in Polish literature following the 1863 January Insurrection against Russian rule.(no content)The novel was part of Prus's four novels addressing "great questions of our age," with "The Doll" specifically focusing on the aristocracy and townspeople and on idealists struggling to bring about social reforms.

### Academic Resources

The search results indicate there are academic papers available, including one specifically examining the 1881 Anti-Jewish Pogrom in Warsaw as depicted in "Lalka."(no content)Prus's works have been translated into many languages, with "The Doll" translated into twenty-eight languages, indicating significant international scholarly interest.

The novel serves as a valuable historical document of Warsaw society during the partition period, combining literary realism with detailed social observation of a complex, multicultural urban environment under foreign rule.

Lalka" include themes such as:
- Love as a destructive or motivating force
- Different faces of friendship
- Work as human passion
- Confrontation of dreams with reality
- The city as a friendly or hostile space for humans(no content)"Lalka" appeared on the matura in 2021 as one of the essay topics students could choose, asking: "Does ambition help a person achieve their intended goal? Consider the problem by referring to a fragment of Lalka by Bolesław Prus, the entire work and a selected cultural text".

The novel continues to be a cornerstone of Polish literary education and remains highly relevant for contemporary students preparing for their matura examinations.
